data.title: George Talbot (1670-1733)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for George Talbot born 1670 Worcestershire, England died 1733 Isleworth, London, England including ancestors + descendants + 1 genealogist comments + DNA connections + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
George Talbot

Born 1670 in Worcestershire, England

Ancestors

Son of Gilbert Talbot and Jane (Flatsburg) Talbot

Brother of Gilbert Talbot SSJ and Anne Talbot

Husband of Mary (FitzWilliam) Talbot — married 11 Mar 1719 [location unknown]

Descendants

Died 12 Dec 1733 at about age 63 in Isleworth, London, England [uncertain]

Problems/Questions

Profile last modified 11 Mar 2024 | Created 21 Mar 2016

This page has been accessed 1,475 times.

Biography

The Hon. George Talbot was the son of Gilbert Talbot and Jane Flatsburg. He was born about 1670 in Worcestershire, England. He was a Roman Catholic and so could not inherit his father's titles.

He married Mary FitzWilliam, daughter of Thomas FitzWilliam, 4th Viscount FitzWilliam and Elizabeth Pitt, on 11 March 1719.

He passed away in Shropshire, the family seat, England, on 12 December 1733. He was buried on December 24, 1733 in Albrighton, Shropsbury, England. His eldest son became the 14th Earl of Shrewsbury as he became a Protestant (Church of England).

Children of Hon. George Talbot and Mary FitzWilliam:

George Talbot, 14th Earl of Shrewsbury b. 11 Dec 1719, d. ca. 1787

Barbara Maria Talbot1 b. 12 Feb 1720, d. 9 Nov 1759

Charles Talbot b. 12 Apr 1722, d. 11 Apr 1766

Mary Talbot b. 18 Aug 1723, d. 18 May 1753

John Edward Talbot b. 13 Oct 1724, d. 16 Apr 1751

James Robert Talbot b. 28 Jun 1726, d. 1790

Thomas Joseph Talbot b. 17 Apr 1727, d. 24 Apr 1795

Francis Jerome Talbot b. 30 Sep 1728, d. 22 Nov 1813

Lucy Talbot b. 4 Dec 1732

Sources

http://www.thepeerage.com/p1237.htm#i12362

https://www.genealogieonline.nl/en/whittington-families/I39980.php - gives birth & death information.

http://www.cracroftspeerage.co.uk/shrewsbury1442.htm#SHREWSBURY_1442_10

Ipswich Journal, 15 December 1733 page 3. findmypast

On Wednesday last died, at his Seat at Isleworth in Middlesex, after a tedious Indisposition, the most Noble and Puissant Lord George Talbot, Earl of Shrewsbury, and Baron Talbot in England, and Earl of Wexford and Waterford in Ireland; the first Earl of Great-Britain, and the 14th Earl of that Name.

He married in the Year 1719, Mary, Daughter to Thomas Fitz-Williams Viscount Fitz-Williams of Merion in Ireland, by whom he had Issue one Son and one Daughter, George, Lord Talbot, who is a Minor, and succeeds him in his Titles and Estate; and the Lady Barbara Talbot.

He was descended from Richard Talbot, Esq; who lived in the Reign of William the Conqueror .... (History of the Talbot family and Earls of Shrewsbury)

This last George Earl of Shrewsbury, was second Son of Thomas Talbot of Longford, only Son of John, the 10th Earl of Shrewsbury, who came to the Tittles upon his elder Brother George Talbot, Esq; the 1st of February 1717 18, being in Holy Orders beyond the Sea, when the titles fell to him.

His Lordship did not sit in the House of Peers, on Account of his being of the Roman-Catholick Persuasion.

Note by Martin C. Styan: It interesting to note that this newspaper obituary from 1733 gives a different name of George's father from the sources cited above. This should be investigated further.

Stamford Mercury, 20 December 1733 page 2. findmypast

On Wednesday died at Isleworth, Middlesex, the Right Hon. George Talbot, Earl of Shrewsbury, the first English Earl, and succeeded to the Title of Earl on the Death of his Grace the Duke of Shrewsbury, 1 Feb. 1717-18, his Grace having the Titles of Duke and Marquess only granded to him the Heirs Males of his Body; whereupon the Earldom devolv’d on Gilbert Talbot, eldest surviving Son of John, the tenth Earl of Shrewsbury, by Frances his Wife, Daughter to Thomas Lord Arundell of Wardour; which being beyond the Sea in Holy Oders, the Honours were enjoy’d by his Brother George, the late Earl, who was also a Catholick; which George, Earl of Shrewsbury, married in March 1717-18, Mary Daughter to Thomas Fitzwilliams, Viscount Fitzwilliams of Merion in the Kingdom of Ireland, (by Mrs. Pitt his second Wife, Sister to George Pitt of Stratfield-Sea in Hants, Esq;) by whom he has left Issue one Son, George, born Dec. 11, 1719, and one Daughter, the Lady Barbara.
